page.title: 11ARABLE FARM, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: One{arable farm,}part of which was included in this block, grew crops, some of which were different from the other arable farms.The farm consisted of two farms worked as one unit of 550 acres. Of this, 173 acres were under {winter wheat,}but another 52 acres were under Durom{wheat for pasta. {Winter barley}and{rape}covered 105 acres each.{Potatoes}occupied 38 acres, but these were special potatoes for crisps, and were to be picked by the contractor. A further 22 acres were under{peas,}not for freezing, but for drying to make either mushy peas, to go with chips, or for animal feed. No cattle are kept now, so the sheds built for calf-rearing now shelter machinery. Twentyfive sheep are kept, mainly as a hobby, and there are five geese. A reservoir built to irrigate potatoes is also home for{trout.
